sub_title: Group General Counsel at United Group B.V.
summary: I am the Group General Counsel of United Group BV, the leading telecommunications and media operator in Southeast Europe, majority owned by BC Partners. United Group operates in Greece, Bulgaria, Croatia, Slovenia, Serbia and several other countries.  Prior to joining United Group, I practised law for 15 years in major international law firms in Brussels, London and Paris and served for 4 years as an Associate General Counsel at VEON Ltd.

United Group operates in Greece, Bulgaria, Slovenia, Croatia, Serbia and several other countries. It has 14,380 employees and revenues of €2.6 billion (pro forma 2022).

As Group General Counsel I oversee all legal and regulatory matters and lead a team of over 80 lawyers. Key recent projects include the following:
-	ICSID investment arbitration against the government of Serbia
-	Litigation: multiple disputes with other telecom operators and media companies, appeals against unfair administrative decisions, various other commercial and regulatory disputes
-	M&A: lead on transformational deals including acquisition of Wind Hellas (Greek mobile operator), Optima Telekom (Croatian fixed broadband and pay TV operator), Nova Bulgaria (leading Bulgarian broadcaster) and several other businesses
-	Regulatory: work with the European Commission, national telecommunications/media regulators and competition authorities; achievements include gaining access to incumbents’ infrastructure, obtaining 5G licenses for mobile frequencies, resisting over-regulation of media landscape
-	Government relations: submissions to the EU and national governments in relation to telecommunications and media legislation
- Four completed bond offerings, with €1.8 billion in principal amount across 4 tranches of bonds
- Restructured legal department, including recruitment of 6 heads of legal
- Set up a compliance function, recruited head of compliance, implemented group code of conduct, a whistle-blowing program and data protection policies', 'title': 'Group General Counsel', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 6130, 'name': 'VEON', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFUwB5nJwqJjg/company-logo_400_400/0/1655808125989?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=sKF0prW0HppMjWi18gmXlVHd3E6FyS5mtnwPZmyHTwA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/veon/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Amsterdam, North Holland, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'VEON', 'description': "VEON (formerly VimpelCom) is a NASDAQ and Euronext listed telecoms company operating in 10 countries (including Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Algeria).  It has over 210 million customers and 40,000 employees. 

I provided legal advice on a broad range of telecoms matters including spectrum auctions, network sharing, tower divestitures, interconnect and roaming agreements. In 2019, I worked for 6 months in Tashkent, Uzbekistan as interim Head of Legal of local operational company, led a team of local lawyers and worked with management on a variety of legal, regulatory and compliance matters.

Key projects included the following:
- advising VEON's subsidiaries on regulatory investigations in relation to mobile termination rates (Algeria, Uzbekistan, Kyrgyzstan), national and intra-network roaming (Russia), and billing cycle requirements (Italy)
- ensuring compliance with U.S. sanctions, including the Denial Order imposed on ZTE
- ensuring compliance with currency control laws (Uzbekistan)
- ensuring compliance with EU net neutrality rules, challenging Italian regulator's decision on zero-rating
